00011 /**
00012  * @defgroup DBUF
00013  * @brief buffer that is owner  of stuff that grows dynamically as you add stuff to it;  
00014  * This object owns the memory that it is holding.
00015  * it also has length/size fields, no assumption data includes zeros or not - any data (not just strings).
00016  * @{
00017  */
00018 typedef struct tagDBUF {
00019 
00020   uint8_t *buf;
00021   size_t buf_used;
00022   size_t buf_size;
00023 
00024 } DBUF;
00025 
00026 /**
00027  * @brief initialise a buffer
00028  */
00029 M_INLINE int DBUF_init( DBUF *buf, size_t init_size )
00030 {
00031   buf->buf = malloc( init_size );
00032   if (!buf->buf) {
00033     return -1;
00034   }
00035   buf->buf_used = 0;
00036   buf->buf_size = init_size;
00037   return 0;
00038 }
00039 
00040 /**
00041  * @brief free memory owned by a buffer
00042  */
00043 M_INLINE void DBUF_free(DBUF *buf) {
00044   if (buf->buf) {
00045     free(buf->buf); 
00046     buf->buf = 0;
00047     buf->buf_used = buf->buf_size = 0;
00048   }
00049 }
00050 
00051 /**
00052  * @brief add stuff to a buffer
00053  */
00054 int DBUF_add(  DBUF* buf, void *data, size_t data_size );
00055 
00056 
00057 M_INLINE  void * DBUF_buffer( DBUF *buf )
00058 {
00059   return buf->buf;
00060 }
00061 
00062 M_INLINE size_t DBUF_size( DBUF *buf )
00063 {
00064   return buf->buf_used;
00065 }
00066  
00067 /**
00068  * @}
00069  */
00070 
00071 #ifdef  __cplusplus
00072 }
